text: Nahid Hagigat or Nahid Haghighat (Persian: ناهید حقیقت) is an Iranian-American illustrator and artist, located in New York City. She is well known for her paintings and prints with layered imagery. ==Biography== Born in 1943 in Iran. In the early 1970s she studied Fine Arts at New York University (NYU) and met her husband, artist Nicky Nodjoumi while in school. She has a Ph.D in Art Education from New York University (NYU) and a Ph.D from Huntington Pacific University in Behavioral Therapy. Her work is part of the permanent collection at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. === Illustrations === * Muna, CD/Album cover, music by Markéta Irglová, 2014 * Anar, CD/Album cover, music by Markéta Irglová, 2011 * Half for You, written by M. Azad, 2010 * The Valiant Little Potter, retold by Erick Berry, 1973 * The Story of the Little Robin, written by M.
